reviews.review_msg: Funny guy, hard marker, tests can be tough.

I don't understand the hatred.  Weldon is teaching two of the most obnoxious classes in POL at SFU, 201 and 231, and making them bearable.  Intelligent, honest, and, despite what others have said, helpful when help is needed.  He marks hard, but if you know your stuff you're in for a good mark.  He's really a good guy in my opinion.

He's a very nice guy, see him in his office and will help you to some extent. He loves the content covered. At the same time he's totally full of himself. Talks about the most irrelevant things and nothing covered in class nor worth any meat is covered in the final. The final is a vocab test. Not recommended unless required for degree.
Great prof! Straightforward, everything you needed to know was either in lecture slides or the textbook.
Her exams are fair, all the materials are covered in the lecture. Just listen in class and you will be fine.

A waste of time!  Sandra is so boring... Tries to involve the class in discussions that go nowhere. Quotation assignments are easy marks but practically irrelevant. Her custom courseware isn't fit for the fire. I don't think I learned anything in this course.

Horrible. i have no idea what i am supposed to study for the final. the assignments are irrelevant to what we are learning. the topic overall seems interesting, but she kills it. i feel sorry for the TA's cause she is butchering their major, making it look bad.

Terrible, utterly terrible.  Fatuous, paternalistic and self righteous teaching style; randomn and inappropriate assignments and marking.  I have learned absolutely nothing in this class to date - it never once made me think (except of semester's end with longing...)

She is a fair marker, but her lectures tend to be dry and by the end, most students were yawning and few were paying much attention. She may not be the worst PoliSci professor, but definitely isn't the best.
very friendly and helpful prof, but her lectures are REALLY boring, and she tends to go offtopic.  she is also very knowledgeable, and quite clear in her lectures. overall i'll take her class again

Well... her lectures leave something to desire... she's one of those that put everything on the powerpoint then reads it off and then sends it to you.... and the course turns out more like a HIST than a Comp. Pol. course... nice, but not great lecturer
Course is super easy but lectures were painful. She rambles about uninteresting and unrelated stuff for half the class. By the middle of the semester attendance to lecture was only 30%, if that.
Very nice person - but half the time doesn't know what she's trying to say
This class is so bad, it's laughable. Not only is she a boring speaker, but what is up with all the etcs...I mean it is practically every other word out of her mouth.
stop asking the class questions that you don't know the answer to!!!!! BOR-RING!
Incredibly boring, not sure what class is about...6 weeks in/wastes time a lot!
